articles.author: Ted Hesson
articles.description: U.S. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem will end deportation protections for half a million Haitians, the latest move by the Trump administration to strip migrants of legal status as it ramps up deportations.
articles.title: Trump administration to end deportation relief for Haitian migrants

articles.author: Olivia Le Poidevin
articles.description: The Geneva branch of an Israeli- and U.S.-backed group that delivers aid to Gaza has been ordered to comply with its registration requirements or face possible court action.
articles.title: Geneva branch of Gaza aid delivery group could face court action

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran's foreign minister Abbas Araqchi indicated on Friday that Tehran may reject any request by the head of UN nuclear watchdog the IAEA for visits to Iranian nuclear sites.
articles.title: Araqchi signals Iran may block UN visits to bombed nuclear sites

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Jonathan Saul, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Short of commanders, deprived of much of its tunnel network and unsure of support from its ally Iran, Hamas is battling to survive in Gaza in the face of rebellious local clans and relentless Israeli military pressure.
articles.title: Battling to survive, Hamas faces defiant clans and doubts over Iran

articles.author: Nandita Bose, David Lawder
articles.description: The United States and China have resolved issues surrounding shipments of rare earth minerals and magnets to the U.S., Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Friday, ironing out a dispute that stalled a deal reached in May.
articles.title: US says deal with Beijing will expedite rare earth exports from China

articles.author: Jacob Gronholt-Pedersen
articles.description: The head of Denmark's Arctic command said the prospect of a U.S. takeover of Greenland was not keeping him up at night after talks with a senior U.S. general last week but that more must be done to deter any Russian attack on the Arctic island.
articles.title: Exclusive: Danish general says he is not losing sleep over US plans for Greenland

articles.author: Andrew Chung
articles.description: The court dealt a blow to federal judges' power by restricting the scope of their rulings as litigation challenging President Trump's immigration policy plays out.
articles.title: In win for Trump, US Supreme Court limits judges' power to block birthright citizenship order

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's Military Advocate General has ordered an investigation into possible war crimes over allegations that Israeli forces deliberately fired at Palestinian civilians near Gaza aid distribution sites, Haaretz newspaper reported on Friday.
articles.title: Israeli military orders war crime probe into Gaza shootings, paper says

articles.author: Gleb Bryanski, Vladimir Soldatkin
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that Russia was looking to cut its military expenditure from next year, contrasting that with NATO's plan to ramp up defence spending over the next decade.
articles.title: Putin says Russia plans to cut military spending from next year

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said on Friday that a U.S.-backed aid operation in Gaza is “inherently unsafe,” giving a blunt assessment: “It is killing people.”
articles.title: UN chief calls US-backed Gaza aid operation unsafe, is killing people
